image.altText: Gus Atkinson clutches at his left hamstring

props.synopsis: England's tour goes from bad to worse as the early wicket-taker Gus Atkinson is forced off the field with an apparent hamstring injury. Follow live.

title.children: Atkinson limps off injured after removing Boland early

image.altText: a yacht in spray

props.synopsis: Master Lock Comanche has kept its narrow lead over long-time rival LawConnect in the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race overnight as the two supermaxis race down Australia's east coast for day two of the blue water classic.

title.children: 'Very uncomfortable cold, wet night' for crews as five yachts eye Sydney to Hobart line honours

image.altText: Fireworks are seen over the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge during New Year’s Eve celebrations 2024

props.synopsis: Sydney's New Year's Eve celebrations will this year pay tribute to the victims of the Bondi terror attack, with events to feature a heavy police presence. Here is everything you need to know to plan your night.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the Sydney New Year's Eve fireworks

image.altText: Two police officers arrest a man, who has his head covered.

props.synopsis: A man is arrested following a Melbourne crime spree that allegedly began about 7pm on Christmas Day and ended with burglaries of two restaurants about 6:30am on Boxing Day.

title.children: Man charged with string of offences after burglaries on Christmas Day

image.altText: Close up of ladybugs

props.synopsis: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

title.children: 'Voracious feeders' set loose at Parliament House to take out pests

image.altText: A man with voluminous hair and a black jacket plucks the strings of a black electric guitar on a stage

props.synopsis: The Cure guitarist and keyboard player Perry Bamonte has died aged 65, the legendary British dark rock band announced on Friday.

title.children: The Cure guitarist and keyboard player Perry Bamonte dies aged 65

image.altText: ghislaine maxwell and jeffrey epstein seen together on a black background

props.synopsis: The arts camp was prestigious, and "Jane" had travelled almost 2,500 kilometres to attend. As she sat by herself on a bench between classes, a man and a woman approached her.

title.children: Inside the grooming process that made Epstein and Maxwell so dangerous

image.altText: Man pouring champagne into glasses

props.synopsis: Health-conscious Australians might be thinking twice about having that first or second beer, but not all of us are getting the message when it comes to alcohol and risky drinking.

title.children: Australians are drinking less, except one age group

image.altText: A police boat near two people lying on paddleboards in a green choppy sea.

props.synopsis: Police say two holidaymakers are lucky to be alive after being rescued from the cold waters of Port Phillip, south-west of Melbourne, on Christmas Day.

title.children: Mother and stepson drift 10 kilometres in Christmas paddleboard mishap

image.altText: water over a road

props.synopsis: Holiday travellers are being urged to check road closures before setting off on their journey, with parts of the state expecting rain into the middle of next week.

title.children: Parts of Queensland bracing for heavy rain and potential flooding

image.altText: A wind turbine in the foreground with others in the background among pine trees

props.synopsis: In a tiny town near the Victoria–South Australia border, a proposed wind farm near a protected wetland is posing a big question for Australia's planning regulators.

title.children: When green energy threatens what it is meant to save

image.altText: A woman wearing Somaliland colours.

props.synopsis: Matters of strategy are behind Israel's drive to recognise Somaliland, analysts say, as Arab nations worry about instability in the region.

title.children: Somalia, Arab nations denounce Israeli recognition of Somaliland

image.altText: Police officers stand guard at the scene of a stabbing

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested after stabbing eight people at a factory in the Japanese city of Mishima.

title.children: At least 14 injured in a knife and chemical attack at factory in Japan

image.altText: A open room with large windows and furniture all over the carpet floor after an explosion.

props.synopsis: The attack has been claimed by the ultra-conservative Sunni group Saraya Ansar al-Sunnah, which was also responsible for a Damascus church bombing in June.

title.children: Mosque blast during Friday prayers kills eight in Syria

image.altText: Myanmar politician Ko Ko Gyi stands at a lectern dressed in yellow

props.synopsis: Five years after the military toppled a democratically elected government and imprisoned its leaders, the country is preparing to hold national elections beginning on December 28.

title.children: Myanmar's first election in five years begins – but experts warn it's a sham

image.altText: A woman in a black shirt sitting on a chair outside.

props.synopsis: Lucinda is a member of an exclusive club — living heart donors, and is the only woman to have a baby after a heart-lung-liver transplant

title.children: Lucinda donated her heart to another woman 20 years ago. She's still alive to tell the tale

image.altText: Bright orange rotary landline telephone against a bright blue background

props.synopsis: Here we've gathered a bunch of other things to read while you're relaxing over summer.

title.children: Burnout, landlines and a lost trekker: 13 reads for a holiday weekend

image.altText: A splitscreen graphic showing 50 in orange against a blue background beside another 50 in blue against an orange background

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: ABC 50/50 quiz: Die Hard, pizza and princesses

image.altText: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy with his hand on his chest talks to journalists

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he is planning to meet with US President Donald Trump on Sunday to search for ways to end the war with Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy says he plans to meet with Trump on Sunday

image.altText: A single jet flying in the sky, pictured from a level altitude.

props.synopsis: Poland has warned several incidents regarding airspace during the holiday season may signal a provocation.

title.children: Poland intercepts Russian plane, reports airspace breaches from Belarus

image.altText: A side profile of Kelvin who wears a hat and fire gear

props.synopsis: Volunteer firefighters put their lives on the line for their community, despite facing extreme situations, heightened health risks and constant exposure to traumatic events.

title.children: 'My second family': The volunteers risking their lives to keep us safe

image.altText: A man in a grey jacket and white collared shirt smiles in front of a crowd dressed in blue shirts that say "Tim Wilson".

props.synopsis: In a broad ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, Liberal MP Tim Wilson speaks about what the Liberal Party should be fighting for and why he would one day like to be its leader.

title.children: Tim Wilson believes 'most' Liberal MPs would be untroubled by gay leader

image.altText: An old barn with a cracked floor and gutted out on the left, refurbished with lights and bar on the right.

props.synopsis: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

title.children: Historic riverside Nor' West Bend open to public after decades of restoration

image.altText: A red haze of smoke and fire in the background of a paddock.

props.synopsis: The bushfire remains uncontained and out of control, and has burnt through nearly 3,700 hectares.

title.children: Boddington gold mine damaged in out-of-control bushfire

image.altText: Three women smile wearing purple tops and hats holding bags of rubbish in their hands.

props.synopsis: Armed with gloves, bags, buckets and tongs, a trio of passionate rubbish removalists have picked up an award in this regional Western Australia town.

title.children: 'Trashy' trio of retirees receive top community cleaning award

image.altText: An Australian women's tennis player pumps her fist in celebration during a match.

props.synopsis: Popular Australian Storm Hunter is back from injury and adamant she can return to the form that made her the world's top-ranked doubles player.

title.children: Storm warning: Aussie wants to regain world number one status

image.altText: A Hobart Hurricanes cricketer looks down as he limps off the field with his batting partner and a medic next to him.

props.synopsis: Hobart's title defence suffers a huge blow after star batter Tim David injures his hamstring in his team's four-wicket win over the Scorchers.

title.children: Tim David injures hamstring as Hurricanes beat Scorchers

image.altText: Man smiling wearing white helmet and a green and yellow jersey, at an ice rink

props.synopsis: North Queenslanders have been playing the ice-based sport broomball for decades, but dwindling numbers and rising costs have players fearing it may be dying.

title.children: It's a scorcher outside in North Queensland — perfect for broomball

image.altText: A young man leaves court.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old Canberra man accused of performing Nazi salutes in public and spreading extremist propaganda has been released on strict bail conditions after spending Christmas Day in custody.

title.children: Teenager accused of Nazi salutes granted bail in ACT court

image.altText: A building under construction

props.synopsis: Plans for Darwin's new State Square Art Gallery remain unclear, with the Northern Territory arts minister saying he is "eagerly awaiting" an outcome of who will move into the $145 million building.

title.children: NT government blocks release of gallery plan, tourism group bids for space

image.altText: Hazel in cricket uniform smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: There was no central catalogue for the scattered histories of women's cricket. That may be about to change.

title.children: Family unearths story of Australian cricket's 'girl Bradman' Hazel Pritchard

image.altText: A sign on the front of a conrete building reads Mallee District Aboriginal Corporation

props.synopsis: An annual meeting to elect a new board at Mallee District Aboriginal Services has led to divisions among members and incoming board members as the chair announces elections will be re-run.

title.children: Director nominations for Mallee Aboriginal health board create division

image.altText: A giant kewpie doll follows the crowd at the Sydney 2000 closing ceremony.

props.synopsis: For Trevor Harvey, honouring a departed mate meant one thing — finding a 6-metre-tall Kewpie doll from the Sydney Olympics.

title.children: Searching for the Sydney Olympics' closing ceremony stars, 25 years on

image.altText: A young Kamahl fronting his television show with the ABC orchestra

props.synopsis: At 91, Malaysian-born Australian entertainment legend Kamahl reflects on his life and career.

title.children: Kamahl reflects on his life and career as he finishes likely final recording
